item.title: FormatEnumerationLimit - Reduce Truncating Output
item.description: Sometimes there is output from a cmdlet that gets truncated on the screen, even though there is more space to fill in the console window. To not truncate the output of your PowerShell commands set the variable $FormatEnumerationLimit to -1 $FormatEnumerationLimit=-1 Now the output from cmdlets will fill the console window. So what is the $FormatEnumerationLimit variable? Here is the definition from the about_preferences doc: $FormatEnumerationLimit Determines how many enumerated items are included in a display.

item.title: Setting PowerShell as the Default Shell in Server Core
item.description: The default shell for Windows Server Core is the command prompt. Ideally you will change that to PowerShell so you don’t have to manually run PowerShell if you ever need to RDP into the server. To make this change login to your server core machine and run PowerShell: C:\windows\system32\powershell.exe Edit the registry to set PowerShell as the default Shell: Set-ItemProperty -Path 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon' -Name Shell -Value 'powershell.exe' The next time you login the shell will immediately run PowerShell.
